h4.NemesisTeamIndexReady (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_NemesisTeamIndexReady_GameServerLib]

This function will set the mapstate nemesis team index if it hasn't been set and the leader is present.

This function will set the mapstate nemesis team leader if it hasn't been set and the leader is present)

h4.GrantFFAPvPRewardToEntArray (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_GrantFFAPvPRewardToEntArray_GameServerLib]
*No Return*
*Parameter 1: entsIn (Entity Array)*
*Parameter 2: reward_table_name (string)*
*Parameter 3: totalScoreValueName (string)*
*Parameter 4: totalPlayers (int)*
*Parameter 5: winner (int)*
*Parameter 6: personalScoreValueName (string)*
*Parameter 7: gameLength (int)*
Grant a reward according to a hardcoded PvP formula for players on a free-for-all map.  Keeps designer expressions simpler and avoids typos
The PvP equation is: (2 * score / (score + average_score + 1)) + winner) / 3


h4.GrantPvPRewardToEntArray (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_GrantPvPRewardToEntArray_GameServerLib]
*No Return*
*Parameter 1: entsIn (Entity Array)*
*Parameter 2: reward_table_name (string)*
*Parameter 3: teamScoreValueName (string)*
*Parameter 4: opponentScoreValueName (string)*
*Parameter 5: teamWon (int)*
*Parameter 6: personalScoreValueName (string)*
*Parameter 7: personalDeathsValueName (string)*
*Parameter 8: gameLength (int)*
*Parameter 9: personalDamageValueName (string)*
*Parameter 10: personalHealingValueName (string)*
Grant a reward according to a hardcoded PvP formula.  Less flexible than the above, but keeps designer expressions simpler and avoids typos
The PvP equation is: ((teamScore / (teamScore + opponentScore + 1)) + teamWon + (0.75 * ((personalScore + teamScore) / 2) / (teamScore + 1))) / 3


h4.GrantRewardToEntArray (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_GrantRewardToEntArray_GameServerLib]
*No Return*
*Parameter 1: entsIn (Entity Array)*
*Parameter 2: reward_table_name (string)*
Example: GetAllMapPlayers().GrantRewardToEntArray("RewardTableName")


h4.GrantRewardToEntArrayWithScale (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_GrantRewardToEntArrayWithScale_GameServerLib]
*No Return*
*Parameter 1: entsIn (Entity Array)*
*Parameter 2: reward_table_name (string)*
*Parameter 3: subExpr (SubExpression)*
DANGER: Applies the given reward table to every ent in the array  Uses the supplied expression to create
a numeric input for each ent separately.  Can be quite expensive, so use this expression sparingly.
If you use this function to give reward tables with non-numeric rewards, those rewards will materialize at the
players' feet (which may be a design faux pas).
Example: GetAllMapPlayers().GrantRewardToEntArray("RewardTableName", { PlayerMapValueGet(targetEnt, "Score")})


h4.GrantStrongholdPvPRewardToEntArray (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_GrantStrongholdPvPRewardToEntArray_GameServerLib]
*No Return*
*Parameter 1: entsIn (Entity Array)*
*Parameter 2: reward_table_name (string)*
*Parameter 3: teamScoreValueName (string)*
*Parameter 4: opponentScoreValueName (string)*
*Parameter 5: teamKillsValueName (string)*
*Parameter 6: teamWon (int)*
*Parameter 7: personalKillsValueName (string)*
*Parameter 8: personalDeathsValueName (string)*
*Parameter 9: gameLength (int)*
Grant a reward according to a hardcoded PvP formula for players on the stronghold apocalypse map.  Keeps designer expressions simpler and avoids typos
Very similar to the normal table, except that team score is different than the total kills on the map.
The PvP equation is: ((teamScore / (teamScore + opponentScore + 1)) + teamWon + (personalKills / (teamKills + 1))) / 3


h4.GrantZombiePvPRewardToEntArray (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_GrantZombiePvPRewardToEntArray_GameServerLib]
*No Return*
*Parameter 1: allPlayers (Entity Array)*
*Parameter 2: reward_table_name (string)*
*Parameter 3: personalTimeValueName (string)*
*Parameter 4: personalKillsValueName (string)*
*Parameter 5: winnerValueName (string)*
*Parameter 6: gameLength (int)*
Grant a reward according to a hardcoded PvP formula for players on the zombie apocalypse map.  Keeps designer expressions simpler and avoids typos
Very similar to the FFA table, except that score = time + 20*kills, and the total score is calculated rather than passed in.
The PvP equation is: (2 * score / (score + average_score + 1)) + winner) / 3
Must be passed all players on the map

h4.SendExternMessageFloater (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_SendExternMessageFloater_GameServerLib]
*Parameter 1: pcCategory (string)*
*Parameter 2: pcName (string)*
*Parameter 3: r (int)*
*Parameter 4: g (int)*
*Parameter 5: b (int)*
Sends a floater message from the <category> category with tag <name> and colors (<r> <g> <b>)
to whichever players make sense for the current context
If this is called from a mission with an owner, it will only send it to the current owner
If this is called from an encounter, it'll send it to everyone who will get a reward for the current encounter
Otherwise, it'll send the floater to every player on the map

h4.SetNearDeath (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_SetNearDeath_GameServerLib]
*Returns: int*
*Parameter 1: timeout (int)*
Forces a Character into the NearDeath state, if they're alive and not already NearDeath.
If the timer is negative, the NearDeath state is forever.  If the timer is 0 it uses the
default timer for the particular Character (if the Character doesn't normally go into
NearDeath, the default timer is forever).  Otherwise the NearDeath state will
use the specified timer.
Returns the resulting timer value (-1 for forever), or 0 if something went wrong.

h4.SendFloaterMsg (AccessLevel 9) [Notes|Command_SendFloaterMsg_GameServerLib]
*Returns: int*
*Parameter 1: pcMsgKey (string)*
*Parameter 2: r (int)*
*Parameter 3: g (int)*
*Parameter 4: b (int)*
Sends a floater message of specified <floatText> and colors (<r> <g> <b>) to whichever players
make sense for the current context
If this is called from a mission with an owner, it will only send it to the current owner
If this is called from an encounter, it'll send it to everyone who will get a reward for the current encounter
Otherwise, it'll send the floater to every player on the map
